instructions: Tap the i icon next to the phone number (or conversation). Select Block this Caller at the bottom of the Info screen.

Open Settings. Tap Phone. Tap Call Blocking & Identification . Then, either select a phone number to view its details and select to either add or unblock the number or contact or add a contact to block by scrolling to the bottom of all blocked numbers and choosing Block Contact . This step launches your Contacts app so you can select whom to block.
Open Settings . Tap Messages . Scroll to and tap Unknown & Spam . Turn on Filter Unknown Senders .

Open your Phone app. Select the number you want to block. On a Samsung phone, tap Details . If your carrier supports blocking, you'll have a menu item called something like "Block number" or "Reject call" or perhaps "Add to blacklist."
Tap the vertical dot menu in the upper right corner of the screen. Tap Blocked Numbers . Confirm with a tap on Block .
Open your Phone app. Tap Contacts . Tap a name. Tap the pencil icon to edit the contact. Select the menu. Select All calls to voicemail .
